context.p: To enable monitoring by the system:

li.p: Select Infrastructure from the navigation bar.
Click the device name in the device list.
Expand Monitoring Templates in the left panel, and then select Device.
Select Bind Templates from the Action menu.
Add the DNSMonitor template to the list of selected templates, and then click OK.
The DNSMonitor template appears under Monitoring Templates.
Select the DNSMonitor template in the left panel, and change options as needed.

entry.p: Name server against which the nslookup command should be run. If empty (the default), the default DNS server or servers in /etc/resolve.conf are used.
Port on which the name server is listening. This is normally port 53.
Host name to resolve. The default is the device ID.
IP address to which the host name is expected to resolve.
